WRITING.TEXT: Love it, best thing about travelling is the food.
mmmmm starving now, love real meat.
definitely a different way to present it, great focal point for dinner.
totally by Heineken, but has helped Harviestoun - street cred?
Yeah, they are getting stuck in with the pulling. I wouldn't be too pleased being awake during that?
Hielan coos rock. They are pretty friendly and like a good scratch
Yes! Putin isn't a good guy, but neither is the current "democratic" government. Look over there, don't look here.
It looks good but doesn't work :(, better using your hands. I've got one of anyone wants one
Media vans were around George Sq at 10am and still there at 6.30pm when I passed by again. Yet not a sausage ........
Still had to ask Westminster for permission.
Hash browns?!
From the thumbnail looks like a chocolate biscuit with caramel filling
Their stuff looks good but I find it's just very light sponge, lots of air for the #163;. :(
Would more likely be chips, cheese and Chinese curry sauce in Glasgow!
I haz a full bezzy
Stove? Cooker.
have lots of memory space, you will take a lot of photos. Boits are better for walking about as well. Otherwise, some snacks for the bus and enjoy yourself.
ah Glasgow.....
natural yoghurt helps when you have thrush.
A personal Giants Causeway.

helllo, sorry just learning and an oldie (42) i dont wear make up daily so each night its a swipe of garnier miscellular water of over my face, then cotton pad swipe with Kiehls Toner and finish off with Boots No 7 brand moisturiser. Im normal woth oily patches on forehead, nose and chin thx
I value my fingers and neeps are mingin,
American mustard, pah, try English and you'll get fun
looks like black salve has been on the skin before
pumpkin is rank. Mushy, tasteless stuff
i dont eat haggis and tatties....haggis is minging as well
sterilised and still have that feeling argh - be gone with you reproduction nonsense.
is it a Krokodil user?
nice ad for the co-op...
she's a keeper
needs a banana for scale there.
or not drink there.
liking the tatties and spinach additions. Rolling the ingredients would make it more sausage roll and less pastie like. still would eat it #128077;
I'd still try eating that
tomatoes yes, hash brown nope
just imagine if you could,hire folk with backs like this, heaven
Awful. Agree with the comment about Amsterdam. Much better for both sides - clean, safe willies
Manchester shop shut as well and they shop as well as us. Must be big trouble in that company. Saying that their stuff looked like Primark stuff but at three times the price.
Will give a listen, ta for heads up
It was! Wierd stuff but good.
loads of butter on that for me. better under a grill. grill it a bit, then add butter, then under the grill again. heart attack but its tasty
chop them up and stir fry them - tasty.

Could you explain the problems to business caused by the EU? No idea what they are. Otherwise I quite like having the bonus of extra regulations e.g Human Rights Act all the way to sorting out mobile phone eu roaming to length of hours worked. We do vote for them MEP's - http://www.europarl.org.uk/en/your-meps.html
Happy New Year! just woke up after it all
Seriously, google is your friend here.
Keep meaning to go here, so many people saying it's good.
Trading House 50% off, Revolucion de Cuba 40%, Bucks Bar 40%, Thaikun 40%, La Boca by one get one free, The Restaurant Bar and Grill 50%, Viva brazil 30% I'll get digging some more
These are 5 places I think do a good toastie. Anyone know of any others that are tasty?
I did that. Am useless at using the app

A couple of attempts at Baked Alaska. Learned that the meringue topping can slide off and make a lovely mess of the inside of the oven! Apart from that, this was an easy recipe to carry out and using ore-made cake meant it was quick to put together.
Easy to make snack. Store in the fridge or freezer or they will melt due to bring made from coconut oil.
Not a side but something for after dinner. Courgette (Zucchini) Tea Loaf. https://www.foodieexplorers.co.uk/recipe-courgette-tea-loaf/
Another one to do is slice the courgette, sorry Zucchini and grill them. Then place onto plate and drizzle with garlic, oil, mint and lemon juice
Yup, UK as well. Full of sugar and salt and that before you even think of the other stuff added :(
Probably the easiest and tastiest thing to do with pork. Tonkatsu if you want to google it.
Dried beans will usually need soaking overnight and then cooked for around 1-2 hours. What type of beans did you use?
Should be OK, butter would make them taste richer - and is tastier anyway
